page.title: 18Chalkpit Lane
page.content: Chalkpit Lane used to be a coach track to London. The lane is now used for farm machines & motorbikes as well as a footpath & bridleway. There are some caves placed on the west side, half way up above the chalkpit. The chalk was dug from the pit and heated to form lime. Farmers put it on their fields to sweeten the soil. There are tracks at the top of the lane which were used in winter when the main track got muddy. There are high banks at the side because the rain washed the good soil away. There is a Dutch barn with hay in it which is falling apart now. Next to the Dutch barn is a yard with a shelter off the north and east side; it was used for animals in days gone by.
